block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Music

ARTS COUNCIL OF PRINCETON VooDUDES and Chris Harford and the Band of Changes. Today, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Pettoranello Gardens, Mountain Avenue and Route 206, Community Park North, Princeton. (609) 924-8777.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
Music

ARTS COUNCIL OF PRINCETON VooDUDES and Chris Harford and the Band of Changes. Today, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. Free. Pettoranello Gardens, Mountain Avenue and Route 206, Community Park North, Princeton. (609) 924-8777.

CHALFONTE HOTEL ''For Me. . .Formidable!'' cabaret of French songs, featuring Jilline Ringle. Through next Sunday. Performances are at 9 p.m. on Wednesday, Thursday, Saturday and Sunday evenings. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $8 for children under 12. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
CHRIST CONGREGATION CHURCH Princeton Folk Music Society presents Dave Van Ronk. Friday at 8:15 p.m. Tickets: $12; $3 for children, age 11 and under. 50 Walnut Lane, Princeton. (609) 799-0944.

THE CORNERSTONE John Bunch Trio. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Kenny Davern Quartet, featuring John Bunch. Friday at 9 p.m. Pam Purvis Quartet with Bob Ackerman (Reeds). Saturday at 9 p.m. 25 New Street, Metuchen. (732) 549-5306.
ETHICAL CULTURE SOCIETY The Homefries, presented by the Teaneck Cultural Arts Coalition. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $10, $7 for students and older people. 687 Larch Avenue, Teaneck. (201) 287-9730.

FIRST UNITED METHODIST CHURCH The Mel-O-Chords 2000 -- celebrating the 75th anniversary of the Montclair Operetta Club. Performances are Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. 24 N. Fullerton Avenue, Montclair. (973) 890-8850 or (973) 422-0342.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES Shlomo Mintz, violinist, will be featured at the 16th Annual Schwarz Concert. Today at 7 p.m. Tickets: $40 (reserved seating); $35 (general admission). 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, ext. 596.

MAXWELL'S From the Desk of Sally, Years of Static and Ropetree. Today at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $6. 1039 Liquid Soul. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. Semi Automatic, The Turnoffs and Erase Errata. Wednesday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $6. Shiner. Thursday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $6. Todd Snider. Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $10. Blow Up, Circle Square and The Coots. Saturday at 9:30 p.m. Tickets: $6. 1039 Washington Street, Hoboken. (201) 653-1703.
MINSTREL COFFEEHOUSE Vance Gilbert and The Jive Minus Two. Friday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $5. Morris County Park Commission's Cultural Center, 300 Mendham Road, Morristown. (973) 335-9489.

MONMOUTH COUNTY LIBRARY ''Spanish and Hispanic Music -- Two Part Concert,'' featuring Ovidiu Marinescu, cellist, and Chiu-Tze Lin, pianist. Today at 2 p.m. Free. 125 Symmes Drive, Manalapan. (732) 431-7242.
MONTCLAIR PUBLIC LIBRARY Monday Night Music, featuring Wallace Roney, jazz trumpet performer. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $10. 50 South Fullerton Street, Montclair. (973) 509-4910.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Gispy Kings.'' Today at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $38 to $80. 2000-2001 Opening Night Celebration, featuring Danielpour's ''Toward the Splendid City,'' Beethoven's Concerto in D major for Violin and Orchestra, Op. 61 and Respighi's ''Pines of Rome,'' Zdenek Macal, conductor. Thursday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $35 to $500. Respighi's ''Pines of Rome.'' Friday at 8 p.m. and next Tuesday at 1:30 p.m. Tickets: $13 to $54. Prudential Hall. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
OPERA IN THE PARK Today at 5 p.m. Van Neste Park, across from the Fratelli Trattoria Restaurant, Ridgewood. (201) 447-9377.

OUTTA SIGHTS AND SOUNDS Ellis Paul, along with Don Conoscenti and Christopher /Williams. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12 (advance); $15 (at the door). Grace Norton Rogers School Theater, 382 Stockton Street, Hightstown. (609) 259-5764.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Richard Shindell, folk/ blues guitarist and singer. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $10 for older people; $5 for students. Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7844.

SHANGHAI JAZZ Bill Charlap, guitarist, featuring Warren Vache on cornet. Wednesday at 7 p.m. John Bunch, pianist. Thursday at 7 p.m. Winard Harper Trio. Friday at 6:45 and 8:30 p.m.; Saturday at 6:30 and 8:45 p.m. No cover. 24 Main Street, Madison. (973) 822-2899.
SOMERVILLE MIDDLE SCHOOL Scott Kirby, singer/songwriter and acoustic guitarist, and Lew London, fiddle player, will perform for ''First Night.'' Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $8. (908) 500-9280.

STANHOPE HOUSE Keller Williams. Wednesday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $8. Black Widow Blues Band. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $7. Loup Garou. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $10. Blues Power Blues Society presents a Blues Jam, ''Keeping the Blues Alive.'' Next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $5. 45 Main Street, Stanhope. (973) 347-0458.
TRENTON WAR MEMORIAL Respighi's ''Pines of Rome.'' Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $13 to $54. Lafayette and Willow Streets, Trenton. (609) 984-8400.
WHEATON VILLAGE Bram Taylor, British folksinger. Today at 8 p.m. Tickets: $8; $5 for children. Down Jersey Folklife Center, 1501 Glasstown Road, Millville. (856) 825-6800, extension 2762.
Theater

BANANAS COMEDY CLUB Dan Wilson, along with Brian McAllister and Joey Novick. Friday at 9:30 p.m.; Saturday at 8:30 p.m. and 10:45 p.m. Tickets: $10 on Friday; $12 on Saturday. D. L. Hughley, special show. Next Sunday at 7 p.m. and 9:45 p.m. Tickets: $25. Holiday Inn, 283 Route 17 South, Hasbrouck Heights. (201) 727-1090.
BERGEN COUNTY PLAYERS ''Oliver!'' Through Oct. 7. Fridays and Saturdays at 8:30 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $18. The Little Firehouse Theater, 298 Kinderkamack Road, Oradell. (201) 261-4200.

BROOKDALE COMMUNITY COLLEGE Cabaret 2000. Saturday at 9 p.m. (cocktail hour begins at 8 p.m.) Tickets: $40. Performing Arts Center, on campus at 765 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (732) 224-2411 or (732) 938-5454, ext. 26.

EATONTOWN PLAYHOUSE ''Wait Until Dark.'' Saturday through Oct. 8. Fridays at 8:30 p.m.; Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $17 on Fridays and Saturdays; $16 on Sundays; $15 on Fridays and Saturdays for students and older people; $10 on Sundays for students and older people. 37 Highway 35 North, Tower Shopping Center, Eatontown. (732) 460-0100.

ELIZABETH PLAYHOUSE ''The Youngest'' by Philip Barry. Friday through Oct. 15. Performances are Fridays and Saturdays at 7:30 p.m.; and Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $8; $6 for students and older people; $5 on Fridays. 1100 East Jersey Street, Elizabeth. (908) 355-0077.
HELEN HAYES PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Late Nite Catechism.'' Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $21 to $28.50. 117 Main Street, Nyack, N.Y. (914) 358-6333.

HUNTERDON HILLS PLAYHOUSE ''Branson 2000'' featuring Karen Wheeler. Saturday at 11:30 a.m.; next Sunday at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $45 (includes show and lunch/dinner.) Exit 12 off Routes 78 and 22, Perryville. (800) 447-7313.
LUMIA THEATER ''Amnesia Wars.'' Friday and Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $10. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.
LUMIA THEATER -- STAGE II ''Pericles,'' by Shakespeare, directed by Miriam Eusebio. Thursday through next Sunday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Tickets: $7.50. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.
McCARTER THEATER ''The Odyssey.'' Tuesday through Oct. 1. Tickets: $29 to $42. Call for show times. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MURDER TO GO THEATER ''Killing Mr. Withers.'' Ongoing. Fridays and Saturdays at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $45 on Fridays; $48 on Saturdays, includes four-course dinner. Il Giardino, Cedar Knolls. (973) 301-0562.
NEW JERSEY REPERTORY COMPANY ''Losing Randall.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Tickets: $7.50. Lumia Theater, 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.
NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''Antony and Cleopatra.'' Through Sept. 30. Tickets: $25 to $38. Call for show times. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE ''Anything Goes'' starring Chita Rivera and Lee Roy Reams. Through Oct. 15. Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 7:30 p.m.; Thursday and Sunday matinees at 2 p.m.; and Saturday matinees at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $37 to $60. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.

PLAYHOUSE 22 ''Once Upon a Mattress.'' Through Oct. 7. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sunday matinees at 3 p.m. Tickets: $16; $12 for students and older people. 210 Dunhams Corner Road, East Brunswick. (732) 254-3939.

RITZ THEATER ''Vaudeville Villains,'' comedy by Alex Wilkie. Through Oct. 7. Performances are Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m.; Wednesdays, Sept. 20 and Oct. 4 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $16 (Fridays and Saturdays); $12.50 (Sundays); $15 (Wednesdays). 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (609) 858-5230.

STUDIO PLAYHOUSE ''How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying!'' Through Sept. 23. Friday and Saturday performances at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 5 p.m. Tickets: $15. 14 Alvin Place, Upper Montclair. (973) 744-9752.

TOVA THEATRE COMPANY ''Two Sides of the Moon,'' written and performed by Vietnamese refugees. Saturday at 6:30 p.m. Tickets: $10 (donation); $5 (donation) for students and older people. P. S. 17, 600 Bergen Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 653-3888, ext. 22.

TWELVE MILES WEST THEATRE COMPANY ''Shakespeare's R+J,'' adapted by Joe Calarco. Through Sept. 30. Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $20; $15 for students and older people. (973) 746-7181.
TWO RIVER THEATER COMPANY ''Arms and the Man.'' Through Sept. 24. Call for show times. Tickets: $19 to $34. Algonquin Arts Theater, 171 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 345-1400.

VAGABOND PLAYERS ''Broadway's Best,'' a musical revue of some of the best songs Broadway has to offer this year. Through Sept. 24. Saturdays and Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $10; $8 for children under 12 and older people.Shore Hills Country Club, Morse Place, Landing. (973) 398-3565.
WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER Phil Hochman and John McMenamin, comedy concert. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10. 18 Sterling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.
Museums and Galleries

ABC GALLERY ''The Fruits of My Labor, Oil Paintings and Pastels by Fern Blumberg.'' Through Sept. 29. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 1 p.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Lambertville Public Library, 6 Lilly Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-0275.

AMERICAN LABOR MUSEUM ''Workers' Portraits,'' photodocumentary exhibit by Robert Gumpert. Through Dec. 31. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. Botto House National Landmark, 83 Norwood Street, Haledon. (973) 595-7953.

ARTISTS' GALLERY Bernard Ungerleider, paintings, and Bernard Mangiaracina, sculptures. Through Oct. 1. Hours: Fridays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. 32 Coryell Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-4588.

ATRIUM GALLERY ''Fanciful Visions,'' exhibition featuring a collection of paintings by Andrea Baruffi. Through Oct. 31. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. Chubb, 15 Mountain View Road, Warren. (908) 903-2608.
BARRON ARTS CENTER The Camera Arts Group exhibit. Through Oct. 1. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. 582 Rahway Avenue, Woodbridge. (732) 634-0413.

BERLEX LABORATORIES CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS ''Parallel Visions: A Compilation of GJ Cloninger and Co. Gallery Artists.'' Through Nov. 15. By appointment. 340 Changebridge Road, Montville. (973) 276-2000.

BRION GALLERIES ''Impressions of New Jersey: Beauty, Botany and Everyday People of the Garden State.'' ''Visions in Mexico: Oil Paintings by Nina Wisniewski.'' Through Sept. 24. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. 1293 Route 179, Lambertville. (609) 397-7030.
CARDINAL ART GALLERY Robert Bateman: one man show and personal appearance. Saturday, 3 p.m. to 6 p.m. Route 94 and Vernon Crossing, Vernon. (973) 764-5050.
CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Drawn to the Sea,'' watercolors by Alice Steer Wilson. Through Oct. 15. Solarium and Magnolia Rooms, 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
CHAMOT GALLERY ''From Pop to the Millennium: 40 Years of Bill Barrell.'' Through Sept. 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 6 p.m. 111 First Street, Jersey City. (201) 610-1468.

CLIFTON ARTS CENTER ''Open Shutters,'' group show by the Clifton Camera Club. Thursday through Oct. 15. Opening reception: Thursday, 7 p.m. to 9 p.m. Hours: Thursday through Sunday, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Clifton and Van Houten Avenues, Clifton. (973) 472-5499.

DRUE CHRYST GALLERY Elaine Kurie, oil still lifes and landscapes. Through Sept. 30. Hours: Mondays, Thursdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; or by appointment. 21 White Deer Plaza, Lake Mohawk, Sparta. (973) 729-0609.

EXTENSION GALLERY Atelier Members' Exhibit, ''Sculptures Created in or Incorporating Stone.'' Through Oct. 5. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 60 Ward Avenue Extension, Mercerville. (609) 890-7777.

FAIRLEIGH DICKINSON UNIVERSITY ''Laid by Liberty'' acrylic paintings by Alex Lombardo. Through Oct. 6. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Edward Williams Gallery, 150 Kotte Place, Hackensack. (201) 692-2449.

GALLERY ONE MAIN ''People's Choice Awards'' art show. Today through Oct. 8. Opening reception: today, 1 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Route 513, Highbridge. (908) 638-3838.

GUILD OF CREATIVE ART ''8th Annual Juried Open Show.'' Tomorrow through Oct. 9. Opening reception: next Sunday, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m.; awards ceremony at 3 p.m. Hours: daily, noon to 4:30 p.m. 620 Broad Street, Shrewsbury. (732) 741-1441.

J. C. C. METROWEST ''Reflections on Kiddush Sets: Sterling Silver Judaica,'' by Leo Contini. Through Dec. 24. Marantz Art Gallery, J.C.C. of Metropolitan, 760 Northfield Avenue, West Orange. (973) 736-3200, ext. 330.

J.C.C. ON THE PALISADES ''Yemenite Jews: The Last Generation'' photographic exhibition. Through Sept. 29. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 9 a.m to 10 p.m.; Friday and Sunday, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. 411 East Clinton Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 569-7900, extension 433.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM ''The Prints of a Sculptor,'' by Melvin Edwards. Through Oct. 7. Hours: Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.to 8 p.m. 472 Jersey Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 547-4514.
JOHNSON & JOHNSON HEADQUARTERS GALLERY Barbara Weissberger, drawings. Through Oct. 13. Call for appointment only. 1 Johnson and Johnson Plaza, New Brunswick. (732) 524-6957.

KENT PLACE GALLERY ''Fantasy Mania,'' prints and sculptures by Florence Wint. Tomorrow through Oct. 6. Opening reception: Friday, 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 4 p.m. 42 Norwood Avenue, Summit. (908) 273-0900.

KERYGMA GALLERY ''Paintings,'' one-person show by Frank Trefny. Tuesday through Oct. 7. Opening reception: next Sunday, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. 38 Oak Street, Ridgewood. (201) 444-5510.

MACCULLOCH HALL HISTORICAL MUSEUM ''Lasting Impressions,'' an exhibit on the history and techniques of printmaking. Through Jan. 14, 2001. ''Fulper's Changing Wares'' by Dr. Gordon W. Gray. Today at 4 p.m. Admission: $4; $3 for older people and students. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 45 Macculloch Avenue, Morristown. (973) 538-2404.

MERCER COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE ''Narrative Stance,'' exhibition of two Mercer County artists, Loring Hughes of Lawrenceville and Thomas Kelly of Trenton. Through Sept. 28. Hours: Mondays, 12:30 to 3 p.m.; Tuesdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Wednesdays and Thursdays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. and 6 to 8 p.m. The Gallery, Communications Center, 1200 Old Trenton Road, Trenton. (609) 586-4800, extension 3588.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Lyrical Visions: Music and Dance in American and Native American Art.'' ''Georgia O'Keefe: The Artist's Landscape, Photographs by Todd Webb.'' Through Jan. 7, 2001. ''Croquet: The Art of Play.' Through Oct. 15 (course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.) Admission: $7; $4 for children. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''1900,'' exhibit of photos, products and objects. Through September. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $4; $2 for students. Acorn Hall, 68 Morris Avenue, Morristown. (973) 267-3465.

MORRIS MUSEUM New Jersey Arts Annual: ''Everything for the Home'' juried exhibition. Through Nov. 17. ''Art and Nature: The Hudson River School'' exhibition. Next Sunday through Nov. 19. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

MUSEUM OF EARLY TRADES AND CRAFTS ''Time Made Visible: An Exhibit on Time and Timepieces.'' Through Dec. 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $3.50; $2 for students, children over 5 and older people. Main Street at Green Village Road, Madison. (973) 377-2982.

MUSEUM OF THE AMERICAN HUNGARIAN FOUNDATION ''Then and Now: Recent Museum Acquisitions of Art and Folk Art.'' Through next Sunday. ''Count Maurice Benyowsky, An 18th Century World-Traveler from Historic Hungary.'' Through Sept. 22. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 300 Somerset Street, New Brunswick. (732) 846-5777.
NABISCO GALLERY ''Preserving the Garden: Saving New Jersey Landscape.'' Tomorrow through Oct. 18. Hours: daily, noon to 4 p.m. 100 DeForest Avenue, East Hanover. (973) 503-2000.

NEW JERSEY CENTER FOR VISUAL ARTS ''As if Alive: Animate Sculpture.'' Today through Oct. 29. Opening reception: today, 2 p.m. to 5 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, noon to 4 p.m.; Thursdays, 7 to 9 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. Palmer Gallery, 68 Elm Street, Summit. (908) 273-9121.

NEW JERSEY CITY UNIVERSITY ''Recent Paintings and Drawings by Jose Morales.'' Tomorrow through Oct. 3. Opening reception: Wednesday, 4:30 p.m. to 7 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. Lemmerman Gallery, Hepburn Hall, Room 323; 2039 Kennedy Boulevard, Jersey City. (201) 200-3246.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''The Art of Jack Delano.'' Through Sept. 24. ''Leonard Baskin, Clarence Carter, Jacob Lawrence and George Segal: New Jersey Remembers.'' Through Oct. 22. ''Woven by Tradition and Design: A Selection of American Indian Weavings, Textiles and Baskets.'' Saturday through Jan. 27, 2001. ''Click! The Marvelous in American Vernacular Photography.'' Saturday through Jan. 27, 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Katherine Choy: A Promise Unfulfilled'' ceramic showcase. Through Jan. 7. ''Treasures of 19th Century American Art.'' Through Dec. 3. ''Wetlands.'' Through next Sunday. ''2000 New Jersey Fine Arts Annual: Into the Millennium.'' Through next Sunday. ''The Luminous Image, V,'' and exhibition of illuminated photography. Through Oct. 8. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.
NEWARK PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Spared Lives: The Actions of Three Portuguese Diplomats During World War II.'' Tuesday through Sept. 19. Call for dates and times. 5 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 733-7798.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART ''Art in Boxes: Hers and His Stories.'' Through Jan. 7, 2001. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.
OLD CHURCH CULTURAL CENTER Faculty Show. Through Sept. 29. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. 561 Piermont Road, Demarest. (201) 767-7160.

PATERSON MUSEUM ''Up on Two Wheels: A Look Back at Motorcycling in North Jersey,'' show includes antique, classic, military, police, American, Japanese and European models. Through Sept. 24. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. 2 Market Street, Paterson. (973) 881-3839.

PETERS VALLEY CRAFT EDUCATION CENTER ''Art in the Open: The Peters Valley Gallery Without Walls'' exhibition featuring seven craft artists from New Jersey. Through Sept. 30. 19 Kuhn Road, Layton. (973) 948-5200.

PRINTMAKING COUNCIL OF NEW JERSEY ''Dust Shaped Hearts'' by Don Camp -- A Collection of casein and earth pigment monoprints.'' ''Ulysses Suite'' by Julyen Norman -- woodcuts, and linoleum cuts depicting scenes from the classic novel by James Joyce. Through Oct. 14. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. 440 River Road, North Branch. (908) 725-2110.

RICHARD STOCKTON COLLEGE OF NEW JERSEY Hannah Ueno and Wendel A. White, recent work. Tomorrow through Sept. 21. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesdays until 8 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 4 p.m. Gallery, Room H113, Jim Leeds Road, Pomona. (609) 652-4214.

J. RICHARDS GALLERY Dominigue Dorie, landscapes of Europe. Through Oct. 5. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. 64 East Palisade Avenue, Englewood. (201) 871-1050.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN ''Every Picture Tells a Story,'' an exhibit that explores storytelling through narrative art. Through Nov. 11. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Free. Stedman Gallery, Third Street between Cooper Street and Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6350.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY MABEL SMITH DOUGLASS LIBRARY ''2000-01 Mary H. Dana Women Artists Series.'' Tomorrow through Nov. 1. Mondays through Thursdays, 8 a.m. to 1 a.m.; Fridays, 8 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 1 a.m. George Street and Nichol Avenue, New Brunswick. (732) 932-9407, ext. 26.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - NEWARK ''Carrie Yamaoka: New Paintings.'' Through Oct. 13. Robeson Center Art Gallery, 350 Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Blvd., Newark. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m. (973) 353-5119, ext. 32. Prints and Drawings by Anaida Hernandez, 1989-1999. Through September. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to midnight; Friday, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Saturday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sunday, noon to 10 p.m. Dana Library, 185 University Avenue, Newark. (973) 353-5900.

SIMON GALLERY Larry Deyab and Katherine Parker, paintings. Through Oct. 7. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, noon to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, noon to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. 48 Bank Street, Morristown. (973) 538-5456.

SWAIN GALLERIES ''People, Places and Things'' pastels by Frank Zuccarelli. Through Sept. 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Saturdays, 9:30 a.m. to 4 p.m. 703 Watchung Avenue, Plainfield. (908) 756-1707.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''Vettes in Glasstown XXI,'' an all-corvette show. Today, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. No admission charge to the Gallery of American Craft. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.

WILLIAMS GALLERY ''L'Afrique Peripherique Atlas'' or ''Journey Around Africa,'' exhibition featuring selected etchings by Rolf Weijburg, Dutch artist. Saturday through Oct. 14. Opening reception: Saturday, 5 p.m. to 7 p.m. Hours: Tuesday through Saturday, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. 8 Chambers Street, Princeton. (609) 921-1142.

YOGI BERRA MUSEUM ''El Beisbol Latino: from Clemente to El Duque,'' an exhibition of baseball art, celebrating the greatest Latin American players and their influence. Friday through Nov. 3. ''Championship,'' New York Yankee world championship trophies from 1996, 1998, 1999. Through September. Artifacts from the life of the baseball player and exhibits on the history of the Yankees, baseball in New Jersey, Negro Leagues, evolution of equipment, and baseball during World War II. Ongoing. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Tickets: $4; $2 for children. Montclair State University, 8 Quarry Road, Little Falls. (973) 655-2377.

FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Stuart Little.'' Friday and Sept. 23 at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

NEW JERSEY CHILDREN'S MUSEUM Daily programs: ''Fairy Tale Play'' at 10:30 a.m.; ''Storytime'' at noon; ''Special Craft Project'' at 2:30 p.m. Permanent exhibits: child-size grocery store, pizzeria and castle, prehistoric cave, computers and more. Tickets: $8. 599 Industrial Avenue, Paramus. (201) 262-5151.

PEQUEST TROUT HATCHERY AND NATURAL RESOURCE EDUCATION CENTER ''Canepole Fishing.'' Today at 1 p.m. For children, ages 5 to 7 years old. ''Fly Fishing with Wet Flies.'' Saturday at 10 a.m. Free. Route 46 (nine miles west of Hackettstown), Oxford. (908) 637-4125.

STONY BROOK-MILLSTONE WATERSHED ''Tiny Tots Walks'' for children, ages 18 to 36 months. Friday, 10 a.m. to 10:45 a.m. Fee: $5. Pre-registration is required. Buttinger Nature Center, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-7592.

TRAILSIDE NATURE AND SCIENCE CENTER Planetarium Show. Today and next Sunday at 2 p.m. and 3:30 p.m. Fee: $3; $2.55 for older people. Pre-registration is required. 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.
